newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Besi Q1 1997 book-to-bill above one.
newsitem.headline: Besi Q1 1997 book-to-bill above one.

text.p: The order backlog at BE Semiconductor Industries rose in the first quarter of 1997 to DFL 149.4 million from DFL 140.0 million at December 31, 1996, BESI said in a statement.
The backlog in Systems stood at DFL 134.0 million on March 31, a six percent increase compared to December 31 of last year.
"Market conditions have slightly improved, as we had anticipated at the time of our year-end 1996 earnings release," BESI said in a statement.
"We can report a book-to-bill ratio for the first quarter of 1997 above one, compared to 0.66 for the fourth quarter of 1996," BESI said.
The book-to-bill ratio is the ratio of orders to shipments. If the ratio is above one, this means the value of orders received outstripped that of products shipped.
The company said order rates further accelerated during the month of April, but added overall order visibility remained moderate.
"Given our manufacturing time from order entry to delivery, the increase in orders in the first quarter will not impact second quarter results," BESI said.
